result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:33 AM Defendant Timothy M Buckley in court. Attorney Tripp Stroud in court for Timothy M Buckley.  Attorney Timothy James Gaskell in court as special prosecutor for State of Wisconsin. DA Gaskell notes receipt, this morning, of Defense' motion to dismiss counts 2 and 3; have not had a chance to review. Atty. Stroud - Defense is prepared to go to prelim today; also would like the motion heard today. Court sees the motion; notes it was filed this morning, shortly before this hearing. Court will allow testimony/prelim. State calls agent Freymiller. Freymiller sworn and questioned, direct and cross. Re the motion to dismiss counts 2 and 3, Court sets briefing schedule. Court sets 12/14 at 2 for hearing on Defense motion to dismiss and a ruling re bindover.
Motion hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Motion hearing on December 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
to Dismiss Counts 2 and 3 of the Amended Complaint
Preliminary hearing on October 27, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary Hearing moved from 9/06 due to judicial substitution; reset again from 10/07 at the request of the attorneys.
Preliminary hearing on October 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: to Recuse The Honorable Judge Lisa A. McDougal

1:36 PM Defendant Timothy M Buckley in court.  Attorney Tripp Stroud in court for Timothy M Buckley.  Special prosecutor Vernon County DA Timothy James Gaskell appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court states the charges, noting that the complaint states the offense occurred in Vernon County. DA Gaskell will be amending the complaint or the information to correct the offense location which is Richland County. Court directs Gaskell to correct the complaint. Atty. Stroud indicates the Defense wishes to proceed today with the initial appearance. Court continues the reading of the charges, informing Def of the charges, max. penalties, and his rights including right to prelim. Court sets prelim for 9/6 at 1:30 p.m.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
